intro: Pteronia gymnocline, commonly known as the naked stem pteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Pteronia gymnocline is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
